title: Noise plotter
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to graph the noise your microphone picks up using your microphone and the interactive whiteboard.

Select **InteractiveWriteDraw** to generate a whiteboard.

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/InteractiveWriteDraw-Item.png)

This will be used to plot the noise.

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Press devices again, select **NoiseLevel** to use your smartphone's microphone to capture the intensity of the noise.

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/NoiseLevel-Item.png)

This will be used to have noise values

Press on your smartphone **Add device via QR code**

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Add-device-via-qr-code.png)

and scan the QR code. Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open it locally.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Variables/Variables.png) on the sidebar,

press **create variable** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Variables/create-variable.png)

and create a component called counter,

move the **set variable** to the workspace

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Variables/set-variable.png)

this will be used to count the number of bars plotted.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Functions/Functions.png) on the sidebar,

moves the component in the image below to the workspace

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Functions/function-component.png)

then move the **call-function** component to the workspace

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Functions/call-function.png)

this will be used to create a function that plots the captured noise values.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/Logic.png) on the sidebar,

moves the following components to the workspace

the **if** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/if-component.png)

and the **comparison** component

![comparison](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/comparison-component.png)

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/Math.png) on the sidebar,

move the **basic-operations**
![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/basic-operations-component.png) component,
and move the **number** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/number-component.png) component, to the workspace, three times

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Timing/Timing.png) on the sidebar,

move the **delay** component to the workspace
![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Timing/delay-component.png)

the delay component will be used to know how often to wait to take the next sample.

Moves the following components to the workspace

the **Intensity** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/noise-plotter/intensity.png)

the **Draw** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/noise-plotter/draw.png)

and the **clear** component

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/noise-plotter/clear.png)

Create this function as in the image below

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/noise-plotter/function.png)
this function is for plotting on the board, put the components of the previous steps as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/noise-plotter/blocks.png)

The idea is to use the counter to limit the number of bars to be plotted, after the number of bars to be plotted is reached, the screen is cleared and the plotting starts again.

To sample constantly we will use the main loop component, which allows us to rerun the code after it has finished executing.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Devices.png) on the sidebar.

Then, move to the workspace the main loop component

![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Loops/main-loop-component.png)

and place it as shown in the picture

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/noise-plotter/main-loop.png)
